video.name: Vegan Cardamom Cookies - Cardamom Snickerdoodles. GF option | Vegan Richa Recipes
video.description:
Vegan Cardamom Cookies. These Cookies are a cross between cardamom shortbread and Snickerdoodles. No Palm oil. GF option
FULL RECIPE: https://www.veganricha.com/2018/09/vegan-cardamom-cookies.html
MY BOOKS: https://veganricha.com/mybooks

If you love cardamom, you will love these cookies! Soft, melt in your mouth cookies that remind you of shortbread, snickerdoodle, and Indian Desserts, all rolled into one. 

I use seeds from whole green cardamom pods and ground cardamom for extra flavor punch. The nut butter and almond flour add the texture. The cookie is easily refined sugar free and is palm oil free. Change up the spices to cinnamon, chai, pumpkin pie spice for variation.

___________________________________________________________________________________

Hi, I'm Richa! I create flavorful creative recipes that might need a tiny bit more work, but are totally worth it! Recipes generally include gluten-free, soy-free, and oil-free options. I also wrote 2 cookbooks! Vegan Richa's Indian Kitchen & Vegan Richa's Everyday Kitchen. Lets cook!

recipeIngredient: 1/3 cup smooth almond butter or peanut butter
1 tbsp applesauce or non dairy yogurt
3/4 cup flour ((I use a mix of whole wheat and all purpose), see gf option in notes)
seeds of two green cardamom pods, coarsely crushed ( (or use 1/4 tsp more ground cardamom))
1/4 - 1/2 tsp ground cardamom powder ((us full 1/2 tsp if omitting cardamom seeds))
1 tbsp cane sugar (or use more coconut sugar)

recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl combine peanut butter, oil, Maple syrup, Apple sauce/ yogurt. Mix until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: In a bowl combine peanut butter, oil, Maple syrup, Apple sauce/ yogurt. Mix until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: In another bowl combine the flours, baking powder, baking soda, cream of tartar, salt and cardamom. Mix well
recipeInstructions.name: In another bowl combine the flours, baking powder, baking soda, cream of tartar, salt and cardamom. Mix well

recipeInstructions.text: Add to the wet bowl and combine to form a sticky dough. Add a tablespoon or more flour if the dough is too sticky. You can also do this after chilling.
recipeInstructions.name: Add to the wet bowl and combine to form a sticky dough. Add a tablespoon or more flour if the dough is too sticky. You can also do this after chilling.

recipeInstructions.text: Mix the coating ingredients in a shallow bowl.
recipeInstructions.name: Mix the coating ingredients in a shallow bowl.

recipeInstructions.text: Take the dough out of the fridge. Divide it into equal size balls of inch or larger. Roll the balls into coating mixture and place them on a parchment lined baking sheet and flatten them.
recipeInstructions.name: Take the dough out of the fridge. Divide it into equal size balls of inch or larger. Roll the balls into coating mixture and place them on a parchment lined baking sheet and flatten them.

recipeInstructions.text: Bake at 350 F (176 C) for 11 to 12 minute
recipeInstructions.name: Bake at 350 F (176 C) for 11 to 12 minute
